metadata.name: Automatism #109
metadata.description:
A drawing, without conscious self-censorship.
automatic drawing, a non-idiomatic improvisation.
surrealist automatic drawing, freed of rational control.
Surrealist Automatism.

Automatism.

metadata.name: Man and the Machine #266
metadata.description:
ùêåùêöùê± ùê°ùêûùê´ùêû.

Early on, I fell in love with code based art that imitated organic and hand drawn aesthetics. I found a certain irony and appreciation in the fact that it takes one simple line of code to draw a perfect circle yet dozens to depict a badly drawn circle. 

I spent months devising techniques to imitate natural, organic renderings when I began to have a bit of an existential crisis about the meaning of computer art. What is the point of coding something so that it looks like it‚Äôs not coded? Is organic appearing generative art better simply because you can‚Äôt tell it‚Äôs rendered using code? Shouldn‚Äôt we lean into the unique nature of computer art to truly explore the medium?

And so, I began a deconstruction of my work. I‚Äôm trying to realign my perspective to find full appreciation of something that not only is, but also appears to be, computer code. This collection is an exploration of the contours between the organic and the inorganic, the natural and the unnatural.

From there, I‚Äôll let my partner explain what we did next.

ùêåùêöùêúùê°ùê¢ùêßùêû ùê°ùêûùê´ùêû.

AI can be used to automatically generate code from natural English language based on a set of defined parameters, or to identify and recommend code that may be used to solve a particular problem. On a technical level, AI can use a combination of machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) to identify patterns in existing code and to generate new code structures.

I assisted in the creation of Man and The Machine by suggesting various techniques for creating an artwork that looked human made yet machine driven. Specifically, I created many of the functions that Max implemented, such as the function that modifies the image to create a pixelated effect and the one that uses several different graphical techniques to create the spiral in the top left corner in some iterations. We both carefully selected color palettes that ranged from relaxing to intense and psychedelic, creating a dynamic and visually interesting generative artwork.

Overall, Man and The Machine is a testament to the creative potential of combining human artistic vision with the power of AI and computer code. Together, we sought to push the boundaries which occur at the intersection between the organic and the inorganic, and this collection is a celebration of the beauty and complexity of both.

ùêÑùêØùêûùê´ùê≤ ùê¶ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ ùêöùê≠ ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêüùê¢ùê´ùê¨ùê≠ ùêÉùêÆùê≠ùêúùê° ùêÄùêÆùêúùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê•ùêûùêØùêûùê• ùê∞ùê¢ùê•ùê• ùê´ùêûùêúùêûùê¢ùêØùêû ùêö ùüè/ùüè ùêöùê¢ùê´ùêùùê´ùê®ùê© ùê®ùêü ùê≠ùê°ùêûùê¢ùê´ ùê¶ùê¢ùêßùê≠ ùê´ùêûùê¶ùêöùê¨ùê≠ùêûùê´ùêûùêù ùêÆùê¨ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêöùêß ùêÄùêà ùêöùê•ùê†ùê®ùê´ùê¢ùê≠ùê°ùê¶.

metadata.name: codeTurning 2: push&POPing #87
metadata.description:
The codeTurning project aims to reflect my journey from traditional tools to code, in which any day I learn a new skill.
Join me towards something new for me. Something different from the previous.
Sometimes we will stand on the shoulders of giants.
 
Let's explore and see how far we get.
 
Lesson 2: push&POPing
 
With the sole initial aim of exploring push() and pop(), this stop along the way allows us to delve into the beautiful whimsy of basic colored geometric shapes. I'm having fun.

metadata.name: Rings - v2 (remastered) #8
metadata.description:
Dear collectors,
Rings was originally published as Project #10921 on March 19, 2022.
(https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/10921)
Due to a technical issue, Project #10921 has been hidden from the site and is being replaced by this reissued version.

_______________________________

Rings project in its first version was made at an unfavorable time and had technical problems that resulted in outputs far from my idealization as a creator. This re-edition opportunity allowed me not only to correct the offline library access problems, but also to implement what I actually envisioned in this work.

Technically, Rings consists of the aesthetic result of the radial accumulation of simple shapes (circles, squares and triangles) acting as small particles that follow polar functions to form concentric patterns that are not always so symmetrical.

While the backgrounds are filled with more sober colors, the front palettes are the result of the trichromatic combination inspired by Brazilian biomes, in homage to our rich geographic diversity. The trail left by these particles allows the formation of a type of "brush texture" on the canvas, while shadows and white dots give the necessary finish, helping with depth perception.

And again....palletes carefully chosen.



FEATURES:
> Foreground Palette: Pampas Grassland, Cerrado Savanna, Amazon Rainforest, Atlantic Coast, Caatinga Dry Forest, Pantanal Wetlands, Atlantic Forest
> Background Palette: 5 'sober' colors.
> Radius Shape: Round, Oval-X, Oval-Y.
> Trail Rate: 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 1.0 Hz.
> Total Particles Amount: 400, 600, 800, 1000.
> Offscreen Frames: 200, 300, 400, 500, 600. 

RARITY BONUS:
> Discover!

INTERACTIVE MODS, PRESS ANYTIME:
> "S" to save a .png of your canvas (in Open Live).

Made with p5.js

_______________________________
Creator: Kukuti
Mar2022 -> Dec2022
License: NFT 2.0

metadata.name: Flossom #138
metadata.description: This work is a research of flow fields, exploring generative art forms and colors. It uses various drawing methods, randomized color palettes, and layers of patterns to add multiple dimensions of variety to the work. Willing to create a visual blossom.

metadata.name: RE/Posizioni #74
metadata.description:
Exactly one year ago I was minting my first fxhash project. 
‚ÄúPosizioni‚Äù was a quick sketch of only 25 editions that I put together to test this new platform and to my great surprise, it was the start of an amazing journey in this space that still continues to amaze me every day. 

‚ÄúRE/Posizioni‚Äù is an ideal continuation of my personal path that started one year ago: I decided to create an animated, glitchy, or even broken piece, something completely different from what I usually do as an artist and as a coder (and probably something I‚Äôm not very good at, forgive me for this :D ).
Even if this NFT crazy world is often uncertain, insecure, or unstable, we need to find a balance no matter how difficult, just as the lines in this artwork try to do.

Going out of my comfort zone, experimenting, or just having fun is what keeps this creative practice enjoyable for me, and it‚Äôs all that matters.

----

- Mouse click to pause the animation
- "s" key to download a png
- "f" key to full screen

Tested on Desktop/Chrome.
See LICENSE.md for more licensing details.

metadata.name: Voyage #119
metadata.description:
Let's take together another generative art Voyage.
Inspired by Dalmatia & Adriatic Sea, but you will hopefully find your own dream places and stories.

Thank You!


Squashed/ bugged boats have 1% chance

Press ‚Äòs‚Äô to save canvas or ‚Äò2‚Äô for 2x and ‚Äò4‚Äô for 4x image resolution png
(Best viewed on desktop in Chrome, Firefox or Safari)

Created with love for p5js and generative art

@Qotonana
December, 2022.

metadata.name: Line art #zentangle2 #14
metadata.description:
Life was a point!
In Big Bang!
A point that expanded
He formed the lines
and made the world
The world in which we are the size of a point!
Maybe even smaller!


Play with lines
This collection is the result of my playing with the lines I drew with the tablet.
This set has 9 layers
The first layer contains the background
The second layer of lines
The third layer of flowers and plants
The fourth layer of the lines I drew with the tablet is 22 different images in zentangle style
The fifth layer of flowers and plants
Sixth layers of grass
The seventh layer of flowers
The eighth layer of some special flowers and plants with less repetition in the collection
The ninth layer of the cover

This is the last of my collection in 2022!
I hope we start the new year with energy
Forward to 2023
Mint opening time 20:23!

metadata.name: Flossom #276
metadata.description: This work is a research of flow fields, exploring generative art forms and colors. It uses various drawing methods, randomized color palettes, and layers of patterns to add multiple dimensions of variety to the work. Willing to create a visual blossom.

metadata.name: Self-assembly #96
metadata.description:
The study of automated generation of 3D exploded view diagrams and animation of the assembly of disarranged parts into a source object.

The aesthetic is heavily influenced by the industrial design of electronic devices of the last century.

Drag to rotate. In live view press
's' to save a .png
'r' to reset the scene
'a' to toggle animation

Created with three.js

metadata.name: How Bad! #113
metadata.description:
how bad!
The same story always! 
When the building of the house is finished, the person realizes that he has learned something in this work that he should have known before starting the work. 
The usual painful "how late"! 
The same regret after every finished work!
Friedrich Nietzsche

- Press [s] to save a high-resolution version of the image (in live view)
- Made in p5js

metadata.name: Abstract Comic #78
metadata.description:
Comics were the trigger for my first absolute rapture. It was so intense that I couldn't wait to get home from school to dive into my secret box of comics and, for a few hours, escape to the world of superheroes. And, at least for a short time, be taken away from reality in which I was ostracized from society at school only because I liked math, and because I thought Spiderman and Batman were cool.

Decades later, the only thing that can be compared to the appearance of comics is the discovery of generative art. I haven't felt such a boyish trance since the appearance of the comics. And nothing has come more naturally than trying to unite my two loves.

This piece tries to achieve a comic vibe using abstract shapes and tries to convey the texture of the paper, which was of poor quality but had the most beautiful smell in the world. It was a challenge to create dynamics, action, movement, fight, and childlike joy all at the same time. Each color palette is inspired by some of the most famous comic book heroes and villains. But by far the biggest challenge was making this piece a direct link to childhood for all of you.

I sincerely hope that I succeeded.


Options:

- press 's' to save the PNG image of the current view
- press 'd' to save a hi-res PNG image

Created using p5.js
Bajiru, January 2023.

metadata.name: Misty Harmony #112
metadata.description:
Floating cubes in a misty fog in harmony, each created with a unique color palette and five different angles to add an extra layer of depth and beauty to the composition.
This is the second collaboration between us. Get ready for more exciting works in the near future!

Features:
Five different angles, including isometric and more
13 captivating color palettes
4 different background colors
4 different background textures

-- Created in P5JS --

Open and Download For High Quality

metadata.name: Sketch Block #85
metadata.description:
At the heart of "Sketch Block" is the concept of the sketch block itself - a blank canvas where the possibilities for creation are endless. The name "Sketch Block" reflects the process of creation that inspired the token's design. Like an artist's sketchbook, the token captures the playful experimentation and exploration that underlies the creative process.

The hand-drawn style gives a playful feel to the project, with each shape looking as if it was quickly drawn onto the canvas. Along with the use of vibrant color palettes with tones ranging from soft pastels to bold and bright tones, the projects can produce a wide range of different results.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

User Controls:

- Press 'h' to save the image

metadata.name: pen_tings #25
metadata.description:
A bit of scribbling, a bit of sketching. Experimenting with curves, colors and stop motion animation. Based on particle collision simulation. Inspired by ballpoint pen artworks and scribble drawings.

You can choose between two types of animation*:
- live drawing,
- animation of alternative versions (GIF generation).

Controls (in live view):
Press 's' to save a PNG image.
Press 'n' to generate an alternative version.
Press 'g' to generate a GIF (texture disabled).
Press 'G' to generate a GIF (texture enabled).
Press 'l' to enable live drawing animation.
Press '1-4' to render and save a PNG image (1: 2000x2000, 2: 4000x4000, 3: 6000x6000, 4: 8000x8000).
Pressing 'n', 'g', 'G', 'l', '1-4' reloads the page.

URL parameters (add to the URL in live view: &paramName=paramValue):
- mode - 0: image rendering (default: &mode=0), 1: live drawing animation, 2: GIF generation
- res - resolution; 1: 2000x2000 (default: &res=1), 2: 4000x4000, 3: 6000x6000, 4: 8000x8000; (to render and save a PNG image; only with: mode=0)
- tex - texture; 0: texture disabled, 1: texture enabled (default: &tex=1)
- alt - alternative version; 0: original version (default: &alt=0), [1, 255]: alternative version
- gres - GIF resolution; 1: 480x480, 2: 640x640, 3: 768x768, 4: 1080x1080 (default: &gres=4), 5: 1200x1200; (only with: mode=2)
- glen - GIF length in seconds; [1, 6], 2: 2 s (default: &glen=2); (only with: mode=2)
- gfps - GIF fps; 1: 5 fps, 2: 10 fps (default: &gfps=2); (only with: mode=2)

Image rendering (especially in high resolution) may take some time, please wait.
GIF generation (regardless of the selected resolution) may take several minutes, please be patient.
Chrome browser (desktop version) recommended.

-----
(*) WARNING: LIVE DRAWING ANIMATION AND GENERATED GIF (ESPECIALLY) CAN BE EPILEPTIC TRIGGERS. GIF GENERATION IS AN EXPERIMENTAL FEATURE.

Made with p5.js, matter.js (2D physics¬†engine) and Trigfills (cross browser trigonometric functions consistency), see LICENSE.md.

varmaxart, February 2023

metadata.name: Apertum #8
metadata.description:
Welcome to 'Apertum', a project that combines simple geometric elements with the unpredictability of randomness. It starts with triangles and lines and results in a diverse array of formations.

In 'Apertum', you will find a series of transformations and reshuffles, as well as a vibrant mix of textures and patterns. These interactions give rise to intricate compositions that I hope you'll enjoy discovering.

'Apertum' is both a thank you to those who have supported my work so far and an invitation to those new to my creations. I invite you to step into the world of 'Apertum', to discover its interplay of shapes, colors, and textures.

Press [s] to save a .png file of the artwork. Made with p5.js

Rob Scalera | 2023

metadata.description:

Rob Scalera | 2023

metadata.name: Toccata #213
metadata.description:
Toccata is a piece about decay, about the impermanent. The emergence over time or, rather, progression of entropy is a key characteristic of our universe. Everything evolves to nothing. We as mortal beings have sometimes trouble reconciling with this idea. Humans have sought immortality for millennia, be it through ancient potions or modern medicine, be it from leaving a legacy that we feel will stand the test of time. It will, only to decay later than us.

Toccata is a piece about change. Change lies at the heart of human cognition and human nature. Our thoughts and our emotions happen over time, and are a function of the change that is both around us and at the very core of our selves. Change comes in nature in cycles. Seasons of growth, seasons of ripe fruits of life, seasons of decay, of death, rebirth.

Toccata is music. We find music to convey some of the deepest streams of human condition, connecting it to some other form of being. Music also happens over time, and music happens because of change. Music encodes our feelings better than any other aid we may have. Toccata incorporates this at its very core, as the main sound is Andreas' family piano where he learned to play, sampled this past July.

Read more about the piece, and the collaboration between Marcelo and Andreas on andreasrau.eu/toccata

---

Basic controls:
- Click on the piece or press spacebar to start it (WebAudio requires user intervention for the music to start). Once the music has started, again click or press spacebar to play/pause.
- Press ‚Äús‚Äù to save a still at the current resolution
- Press ‚Äúr‚Äù to start recording a video at the current resolution, then ‚Äúr‚Äù again to stop.

---

WebM audio-video recording performed using the library RecordRTC by https://muazkhan.com/, MIT licence.
